label: 3 easy ways to make the most of your money

tips.html:
Check what you’re entitled to

  • Claim money you’re due

    Speak to your employer about Statutory Maternity Pay or contact Jobcentre Plus or Jobs and Benefits Office if you’re self-employed or on certain benefits.

  • Claim Child Benefit

    Fill in a Child Benefit claim form as soon as you’ve registered the birth â€“ find out more about claiming Child Benefit and get the form - don’t delay or you could lose money.

  • Get free vitamins and vouchers

    You can get free vitamins and healthy start vouchers if you’re on a low income or under 18 - talk to your midwife or doctor.

Find out what you’re eligible for with our quick guide to the main benefits and entitlements.

Plan your spending

  • Check what you can afford

    Use our budget planner so you know where you stand. It will do the sums for you, so you can clearly see what's coming in and going out.

  • Be a savvy spender

    Check out websites, nearly-new shops and parent forums for good pre-used baby equipment and clothes. Can friends or family pass on any baby things?

  • Talk about money

    This is not the time to be shy about how you'll manage. Talk with your partner, family or friends.

Secure your baby‘s future

  • Start saving early

    You'll be amazed how much it adds up. There are plenty of savings options to choose from.

  • Take out or review your life insurance

    It's a must for all parents and may be cheaper than you think.

  • Make or review your will

    It is especially important that you have a will now that you're a parent.
